statement.tex: %text Find the vector equation of the plane which contains the line of intersection of planes % \ora{r}\cdot(\vector{1}{2}{3})-4=0 \\ \ora{r}\cdot(\vector{2}{1}{-1})+5=0 \\ %text and which is perpendicular to the plane % \ora{r}\cdot(\vector{5}{3}{-6})+8=0

step.context: %text Does the following equation represent the (family of) planes that pass through the line of intersection of $\ora{r}\cdot(\vector{1}{2}{3})-4$ and $\ora{r}\cdot(\vector{2}{1}{-1})+5=0$? %
step.reason: %text If $\ora{r}\cdot \ora{n_1}=d_1$ and $\ora{r}\cdot\ora{n_2}=d_2$ are intersecting planes,{\bf the family of planes} that they are part of is given by, % \begin{align} &\left(\ora{r}\cdot \ora{n_1}-d_1\right)+\lambda(\ora{r}\cdot \ora{n_2}-d_2)=0 \\ \implies&\ora{r}\cdot(\ora{n_1}+\lambda\ora{n_2})=d_1+\lambda d_2 \end{align} \\ %text Each distinct value of $\lambda$ represents a different plane passing through the line of intersection of the two planes. Therefore, for the given planes, the equation would be, % \begin{align} \ora{r}\cdot(\vector{1}{2}{3}+\lambda(\vector{2}{1}{-1}))=4-\lambda 5 \\ \ora{r}\cdot(\vector{(1+2\lambda)}{(2+\lambda)}{(3-\lambda)})=4-\lambda 5 \end{align}

step.context: {\small\ora{r}\cdot\left(\vector{(1+2\lambda)}{(2+\lambda)}{(3-\lambda)}\right) =4-\lambda 5} \\ %text For what value of $\lambda$ would the plane represented by the above equation be perpendicular to $\ora{r}\cdot(\vector{5}{3}{-6})=-8$? %
step.reason: %text If two planes $\ora{r}\cdot\ora{n_1}=d_1$ and $\ora{r}\cdot\ora{n_2}=d_2$ are perpendicular, their normals, $\ora{n_1}$ and $\ora{n_2}$ are also perpendicular. Therefore, in this problem, % \begin{align} &{\small \left(\vector{(1+2\lambda)}{(2+\lambda)}{(3-\lambda)}\right)\cdot \left(\vector{5}{3}{-6}\right)=0} \\ &\implies 5(1+2\lambda)+3(2+\lambda)-6(3-\lambda)=0 \\ &\implies \lambda=\dfrac{7}{19} \end{align}

step.context: %text If $\lambda=\dfrac{7}{19}$, is the final equation of plane % {\small\ora{r}\cdot\left(\vector{(1+2\lambda)}{(2+\lambda)}{(3-\lambda)}\right)=4-\lambda 5} \\ %text the following? %
